title: Privacy Setting - VPV
content: Good morning, I would like to re-install the Mozilla VPN. I followed the steps but it is unclear what is the next step. I have used the Mozilla VPN in the past but am now unable to access the program. Can someone please contact me for assistance with re-installing the program. Thank you, I would appreciate it. -Donna
creator: Stuyvesant8d

title: make spell checker less obtuse to enable
content: I've seen other people round the net with the same problem I had. no spell check. it took way too much searching to find out why and how to fix it. even more confusing is on your languages page, it has language pack and dictionary together and no pointer that the language pack will not fix the spellchecker. why don't you just have dictionaries on one page? why don't you link to the dictionaries page from the settings menu where it says "check spelling as you type". this whole thing is so darn obtuse and there is really no reason for it to be. nobody should have to go through this much frustration just to get the darn spellchecker to work.
creator: tremault

title: Crashing causing search engine change
content:
Hi Guys, Firefox crashes now and then, and when it does, it changes my default search engine.

When this happens, "Browser Default" is added to 'search Shortcuts' and selected.

To revert back to Google, it has to be selected, and removed.

I have come to the conclusion, that this is a deliberate action, caused by some form of Malware or similar, as it is the only thing that appears to change, and always happens when Firefox crashes.

On the other rare occasions that Firefox crashes, it returns asking to return to previous sessions, and does so without issue - these crashes are extremely infrequent, however, the previous example is like clockwork.

Hoping you can help.

Cheers, Brad
creator: brad50

title: Orca - how to modify the property ProductName
content:
Hello together,

we need to change the property section from "Mozilla Firefox x64 de" to another value for example "Mozilla Firefox 92.0.1 x64". We made the changes in Orca and saved the "Firefox Setup 92.0.1.msi" file. But when we install the file, we still see in the control panel programs and features the original entry "Mozilla Firefox x64 de". Please, tell us what's wrong. We successfully modify all other possible applications in this way. Thank you for your advice.

Ruediger
creator: ruediger.pelz

title: Firefox 92 removed ALL of my bookmarks and settings.  How can I get them back?!

I just made the mandatory mistake of updating firefox to 92. Now I have no bookmarks whatsoever, and all of my settings are default crap. I can deal with the settings, but I require my bookmarks.

Mozilla was nice enough to overwrite the prior firefox.exe so I can ONLY access 92 (without bookmarks).

This will probably make me never use firefails again. FFS, mozilla, WTF?

Also it seems to save the file in the downloads folder as a "firefox html document" and not a pdf file

title: Recovery Key
content:
I recently set up Firefox Recovery Keys knowing that I was formatting my PC. I am logged into my Firefox account on my laptop and have forgotten my password. Using Firefox Sync and Google Authenticator, I can log into Firefox on my Android.

I am trying to log into Firefox on my PC now, and have forgotten my password, and now none of the Recovery Keys I was given by Firefox are working (I am correct in saying these keys are 10 digits long, and you are given multiple keys when setting up the Recovery Keys?).

I cannot reset my password and lose all of my generated logins. Is there any other way to log into Firefox on desktop, say using google authentication or sync like android?

title: "allow cookies to be stored on this device" warning, but cookies are enabled
content:
Hi there, I have a strange behavior in firefox: when navigating to Yeastar support website (https://support.yeastar.com/hc/en-us) and trying to sign in, i receive the following message: "To continue signing in using Firefox, allow cookies to be stored on this device. You might see this screen more than once. " If I put my username and passwords, I am unable to press the "Sign in" button. If I do the same from an incognito session, the message doesn't appear and I am able to log in through the "Sign in" button (see attached screenshot).

I tried to read many articles about allowing cookies from the firefox documentation but none has solved my problem. I'm running Firefox version 91.0 from a VDI (Citrix Desktop) and I have no admin privileges. Is there anything I can set in order to resolve this problem?

title: How to reset Firefox on my laptop from my android mobile device.
content:
regards,

The Firefox app on laptops and handsets runs very well. well synced too.

the problems I experienced were: when my laptop was damaged and had to enter the service center, I didn't have time to reset the browser. there are many passwords there. logging out of the device in the account settings menu from my android handset likely only stops the browser on the laptop from syncing with the handset, but does not delete the passwords already stored on the laptop Firefox app. (i've tried it on my desktop PC).

thanks in advance for the help.
